article.title: Constraining the Physical State of the Hot Gas Halos in NGC 4649 and NGC 5846

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows merged, exposure-corrected images of NGC 4649 from XMM-Newton MOS (left) and Chandra ACIS (right). What are the white circles in the left panel indicating?
This figure displays the same data as Figure 1 but in the 0.3-2 keV band to emphasize different structures. What does the cyan dashed ellipse represent in both panels?
choices: The region excluded from spectral analysis
The region where ram pressure stripping is evident
The region affected by the nuclear radio source

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure compares surface brightness profiles for NGC 4649 in different sectors. What do the smooth profiles within 12 kpc suggest about the ISM distribution in this galaxy?
choices: The ISM is disturbed by interaction with NGC 4647.
The ISM is significantly affected by ram pressure stripping.
The ISM is fairly relaxed and smooth at these scales.
The ISM shows evidence for strong azimuthal asymmetry.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows combined images of NGC 5846 from XMM-Newton MOS (left) and Chandra ACIS (right). What are the red circles indicating?
This figure displays the same data as Figure 4 but in the 0.3-2 keV band. What do the edges visible in the NE and SW directions likely indicate?
choices: Interaction with the companion galaxy NGC 5850
Radio-mode feedback from the central AGN

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows surface brightness profiles for NGC 5846 in different sectors. In which sector does the gas appear most relaxed, with less evidence of disturbances?
